title: Karma QoL improvements to release with new skin
body:
So, Karma is getting a new skin. Cool. I figured this would be a good time to talk about some minor quality of life improvements that she could use.

1) Mantra Q (Soulfire)

Problem:
Currently, if Karma uses her mantra Q, and then dies, the circle that normally explodes after a short time actually disappears. Most champions have their abilities continue as normal if they die after casting them, and Karma should be no different. I've lost many kills where I could have traded if this didn't happen.

Fix:
**Make it so if Karma dies after she uses Mantra Q, the circle still explodes and deals damage as normal.**
(see bottom of post, apparently mantra Q circle doesn't disappear as much as I thought)

2) Mantra casting

Problem:
Karma suffers from a problem that is inherently unique to her kit. She has an ability (mantra) that affects one of her other abilities but does nothing by itself. No other champions has this type of kit interaction. The problem is that in stressful situations, Karma has to press an extra key to use any of her empowered abilities. Sometimes I press R right before CC wears off and find myself using a normal ability instead of the empowered ability that I thought I used. Sometimes I'm milliseconds too late and I can't even cast the ability because I had to hit R first. Either way, it's very frustrating as a Karma player when my champion has to jump through an extra hoop just to get her to do what I want.

Fix:
**Make it so that Karma can cast Mantra while affected by hard CC. **This means that if you get stunned, you can hit R, and then the instant you escape CC you can use the Mantra empowered ability you want. Riot has stated that "fighting the game" is an aspect they want to reduce/remove, and I feel like here we have that option.
Just to clarify, I do NOT want to change Karma so she can cast a Mantra empowered ability during CC. I just want to change Mantra so it functions the same way Gangplank's W, Alistar's R, etc. all work (aka, castable during CC).

Thoughts, questions?

Thanks for your time.

Follow up edit: I've been testing the Mantra Q disappear-after-death thing and it seems that it does not happen 100% of the time like I thought. I just want to correct that myself and say that it doesn't always disappear. I don't know if something has changed in a recent patch because I know I have seen this happen to me before, but perhaps it's already been fixed. I'm having a hard time replicating it by myself vs. minions/monsters, so it might be constricted to champion interactions. Anyway, the second part dealing with casting mantra during CC is what I REALLY want to change, the first part is more of what I consider a bug fix.

Good suggestions, we'll get those in. 

I'd also like to highlight your approach with this post as really well done. Your statement of problem's explained concisely in a way so that even people less familiar with the champion will get a clear understanding of why it matters and how it compares to similar functionality in game. That's then followed by a separate solution section that directly addresses the stated issue, with a focus on core functionality, not power. Great for making stuff like this really actionable.

I would like to point out that heimer has a very similar ult to karma now. (ever since his rework)

Another problem I'd like to see addressed is that unlike heimer, if karma accidentally activates her ult prematurely or what have you, she is forced to use her mantra or it will be wasted. (effectively being wasted all together if casted any spell is pointless at that point in time)

As for a solution, it would be really nice if you could let karma re-cast her mantra to cancel it (like heimer) or if she simply let's the duration expire, let the cd be refunded or reduced substantially.

If cancel-refund is not an option perhaps some HP and/or Mana regen while it's activated (not on Cooldown or waiting to be used)? Something that could help with the "it has no other use, timing, latency, CC" issues that impact it. 

It can't be too powerful, for obvious reasons so I'm not really sure what would fit best there, but it would stop it form being a Heimer ULT clone.

well, **technically** speaking, heimer's ult is a clone of karma's not the other way around.

Honestly, I miss the paradigm shift of old karma compared to the straight out "upgrade" of the new karma.

Old karma's Q -> RQ went from offense to offense/defense
Old karma's E -> RE went from defense to defense/offense

And it was that (and her great wave clear, super shield, and many other things) that I loved about old karma that I feel new karma simply lacks. Now, that is not to say new karma is bad, far from it. But her play style just feels so different now.



As for the mentioned suggestions, I don't think mana regen is necessary, as I'm pretty certain casting her mantra doesn't use mana. (haven't check recently tho)
maybe nerf her pushing power at early levels against minion waves? extremely frustrating

agreed. You know **exactly** what you want to do. If you have trouble doing that then the game has an issue.

This is exactly what I was trying to convey. Imagine if everyone played LoL telepathically. No keyboard, mouse, you just think it and it happens. We'd never have this problem with Karma, we'd just think "I'm going to cast empowered W the instant this CC wears off" and it would happen, but thanks to latency/having to press an extra key, it's not that easy IRL.

I agree with the first one OP, that I think is a big reason why nobody like Karma (Karma is one of my main supports, I love her she's mah gurl with {{champion:133}} as awesome but underappreciated).  The second one I'm a little iffy on.  Granted, it's not as debilitating as say, casting Cho's feral scream, but I think lets leave the CC ignoring to Olaf and Gangplank.

Karma is a very different case from Olaf or Gangplank though with this suggestion. Even if was able to cast Mantra while affected by hard CC, she wouldn't be able to cast Q/W/E until the CC is over. So that doesn't actually affect any enemies at all, it just makes playing Karma feel better. Olaf and Gangplank breaking out of/ignoring CC is an entirely different story.

I like the first one, the second one if iffy. I don't think I can cast W as Jax while Hard CC'd and prepare an empowered autoattack....why should karma be able to empower her abilities under the same circumstances?
the thing is, Jax is gonna get another autoattack in less than a second. Karma isn't getting another W for about 8 seconds I believe.

Because Jax then only needs to click on someone to bash their face in. His W isn't as integral to his kit. Sure it's important but Karma is all about proper usage of her R. A bad Karma player will generally always save their R for empowered Q's whereas a good one will use the situation to decide.

In the end it's not a bad idea in my opinion at least.

Karma on the other hand, if she failed to use mantra, she casts the weaker version of the spell when she meant to cast the stronger. Zill is gonna HAVE TO use rewind. The game will let karma cast without Mantra though when they meant to use it. This is the problem.

Rock solid. I don't even think shed need nerfed afterwards.

I like both of the options.

I'd just like to jump in here with a note to people who don't play karma about
#why this change is important:

>#Often times, cc will interrupt you during a combo, causing you to miss a mantra:

Scenario 1:

>- You intend to r-w
- You get cc'd just as you hit r
- You cast w, thinking you are casting r-w
- w goes on cooldown without mantra effect :(

Scenario 3:
>- You intend to r-w-q
- you hit r
- you get cc'd as you hit w
- you hit q
- r-q goes off instead of r-w

As we all know, mantra usage is what distinguishes the good karmas from the great karmas. Allowing enemy cc to change your decision is very frustrating, and takes away from a player's ability to gain mastery over karma.

Another thing id like to add (well actually two things), are her W reveal and her RE bugged? shield values.

Karma's W reveal is wonky in that, it reveals the enemy while they are tethered but not while they are rooted, even though i believe the reveal icon stays above there head, her w i feel should reveal the enemy for the duration of the tether and the root, its weird having sight of an enemy and then losing sight because they walked into a bush as they were rooted, you know they're there and can't move but you can't use auto attacks to make use of your passive

Lastly i just wanted to say that Karma should have a haste animation, she was reworked right about the time where haste animations on every new champion was starting to be a thing, but its odd that she has a MS buff ability but doesn't have a haste animation herself, she just does her twisted fate jog.... but faster... (her run animation itself isn't all that pretty for the classy lady that karma is)  I think her haste or new run animation should get rid of the clenched fists, they make her seem tense which doesnt fit her character, i think open hand, flat palms would be better, and a sort of run where she kinda runs to her side with one arm across her chest and the other arm extended behind her would work
